bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 8, 1899

div1.p: Lazear reports that he has been busy since the start of medical school. He discusses the growth of his child.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 8, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. Oct 8. 99
My dear Mother-
div1.p:
Your letter with check for $200
reached me yesterday. We were glad
to hear from you and had been expecting
a letter every day although your letter
written at Hatley but mailed in New York
showed you had reached there safely.

I should like very much to see the Dewey
Arck. It had probably been started when
I came through but I had to rush
across town to catch my train.
Mabel saw it when it was nearly
completed.

I have been very busy since the Medical
School started and expect to be for
some time. I am giving private lessons
again. Several of us have organised
a Quiz at the University of Maryland
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE.
which may bring in a little money
but as yet we cannot tell how much.
Aunt Kate is looking better but
still has trouble with her knee.

She had a tutor for Thomas a scheme
I do not approve of.

I hope you are enjoying New York. You
must try to hear some music.

They are going to have an Opera Company
at the Music Hall here for a good
part of the winter.

William is as early as ever. I think
he will be walking soon. He knows
how to use his feet but we
do not encourage him. He is now
the possessor of one tooth.
